title: TikTok Strikes Deal to Split Off an American Version, Ending Long Legal Saga
summary: The Chinese parent company for the popular video app said it had struck a deal with a group of non-Chinese investors to create a new American TikTok to avoid a ban in the United States.

title: Jack Smith Testifies in House Hearing About Trump Investigations
summary: The former special prosecutor argued a case he was never allowed to in court: that President Trump “engaged in criminal activity” that undermined democracy.

title: Takeaways From Jack Smith’s Testimony on Trump Investigations
summary: In his remarks, the former special counsel repeatedly denied that he had acted out of partisan animus and bemoaned the Trump administration’s efforts to go after the president’s perceived enemies.

title: House Passes Spending Package Over Democratic Revolt on ICE
summary: Approval of the package, which would fund a wide swath of government agencies, brings Congress closer to meeting a Jan. 30 funding deadline.

title: House Rejects Measure to Bar Military Force in Venezuela
summary: In a tie vote, the House defeated an effort to prohibit the president from using the U.S. military in Venezuela weeks after the raid he ordered that captured the country’s leader.

title: E.P.A. Revives Plan to End Testing on Animals by 2035
summary: Lee Zeldin, the E.P.A. administrator, revived a plan created during the first Trump administration to end the testing of chemicals on mammals.

title: Trump to Expand ‘Mexico City’ Abortion Rule to Include D.E.I. and Gender
summary: The policy has traditionally been aimed at keeping organizations that receive U.S. tax dollars from performing or promoting abortion as a method of family planning.

title: Chicago Jury Acquits Immigrant Accused in Bovino Murder-for-Hire Trial
summary: Prosecutors said a Chicago carpenter had offered a bounty for killing Gregory Bovino, a Border Patrol official. Defense lawyers said he was just sharing a social media post.

title: Immigration Agents Detain 5-Year-Old Boy in Minnesota, Prompting Outrage
